titlestmt.titleproper: BU Records: Sigma Xi, Inclusive: 1954-2002, undated

did.head: Records Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Sigma Xi, the Scientific Research Society. Baylor University Chapter., 1968 -

did.abstract: The BU Records: Sigma Xi collection contains materials related to founding of the chapter on campus as well as materials related to the activities of the organization, such as events and its by-laws.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Sigma Xi, the Scientific Research Society, was founded at Cornell University by Frank Van Vleck and a group of engineering students in 1886. Its purpose to promote research and discussion among all of the scientific fields. The organization quickly spread to other universities and by the 1900’s, there were over a thousand members spread through eight chapters. Throughout the 20th century, the number of chapters continued to expand and were even being established internationally. Today, there are 500 chapters with over 60,000 members here in United States and abroad. The Baylor Chapter of Sigma Xi was founded on 1968 May 4th as the 167th chapter of the organization. It continues to promote research and discussion among the science departments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records of the Baylor chapter of Sigma Xi, an international research society whose programs and activities promote the health of the scientific enterprise and honor scientific achievement. The records are dated from 1968-2002 and contain materials relating to the founding of the organization, its by-laws and constitution, the members, and events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, this collection was arranged in no particular order in labeled and unlabeled folders. Currently, the collection is arranged into one series, I. Chapter Files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BU Records: Sigma Xi, Accession #BU/406, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Jackson Hager. Released on 2019-10-02.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains materials relating to the founding of the chapter, along with its constitution, by-laws, and events. The series is in good condition.
